result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dan E. Lutz

records.addlTxt: 9:00 AM Defendant Dan E. Lutz in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Dan E. Lutz.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes requests a bond modification to a signature bond.  State objects and requests the Court deny the motion.  Court declines to modify the bond and denies the motion.
Motion hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:38 PM Defendant Dan E. Lutz in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Dan E. Lutz.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Requests preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:29 AM Defendant Dan E. Lutz in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Dan E. Lutz.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond.  State objects to request.  Atty. Hayes makes argument for Signature bond.  Eligible for PD representation. Atty. Albrecht makes argument for cash to stay in place.  Nothing has changed.  Gives warrant history, dated but substantial.  DE was given probation and probation was revoked.  Court amends cash bond to $300.00 CASH with same conditions as previously ordered.
Motion hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
4:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dan E. Lutz in court, in custody.  Atty Annie Getsinger also appears in person w/the DE.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests $1,000 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Getsinger responds, requests lesser cash if any.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $400.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times, no possession of any controlled substances w/o valid Rx.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  No possession of alcohol.  No bars/tavern/liquor stores or any business whose primary purpose is the sale/consumption of alcohol.  Submit to PBT if requested to do so by law enforcement.  No contact with the Lake Delton Wal-Mart.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
